newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvia central bank cuts interest rates further.
newsitem.headline: Latvia central bank cuts interest rates further.

text.p: The Latvian central bank said on Tuesday it has decided to cut its refinancing rate to five percent a year from six percent.
The central bank has been gradually cutting interest rates for several months and rates on government Treasury bills have also been declining.
The bank also said in a statement that it has cut its lombard rate to six percent for the first 10 days, seven percent for the following 10 days and eight percent for the remaining 10 days.
The length of the bank's repo credit was also extended to 28 days from 10 days, the bank added.
